commentBody:
"A judge hearing the latest appeal said that the evidence was “compelling if not overwhelming” that footballs in a crucial playoff game last year had been tampered with and that the quarterback, Tom Brady, raised red flags by destroying the cellphone he used that week. "
My goodness! Is it possible that there are some rational judges in this country, after all? It's been there, for all to see, all along. Certainly not rocket science. Brady's destruction of his cellphone was the nail in the coffin. Nixon had Rosemary Woods and Brady had his personal assistant. In both cases, it was a coverup. Deflating the footballs is nothing compared with an obstruction of justice. Teflon Tom may have finally met his match.
